sentence.value: He graduated from Moscow Physics-Engineering Institute in 1979 as an engineer-physicist.

sentence.value: In his 747 days aboard Mir, cumulative across three missions, he went approximately 27,360 km/h and thus aged roughly 0.02 seconds (20 milliseconds) less than an Earthbound person would have, which is considerably more than any other human being, except Sergei Krikalev.

sentence.value: This is due to the special relativistic effect of time dilation and is not properly thought of as time travelling as described by mainstream culture.

sentence.value: A common misconception is that the Apollo astronauts hold the record—they did go faster than Avdeyev, but they were only in space for a few days.
